content.description:
Start at lowest point on the wall.

P1: Up broken rock, sling trees and plug gear. Belay off obvious big tree hanging out. Awkward belay. 5.4 30m

P2: Gully-ish feature above using dead tree. Gear belay on ledge up right. (5.4 25m)

P3: Up right then left on easy climbing past piton to groove with piton. Bulge up right to under big roof. Bolted belay. 5.5 30m

P4: Up right past bolt. Easy rib to ledge. Bolted belay. 5.4 ~30m

P5: Up the amazing chimney! A few bolts. Bolted belay. 5.8+ 30m

P6: Up right and to the top. 5.5 ~40m

Descent: Hike up and down forest to the right.

Variation: Little Bear 5.8R. From the third belay, head up and left on bullet rock to a tree. Full pitch to top up through roof. Good rock, very run-out. 



Centre of wall.

Rack to 3". Single 60. Helmets.

Left side of wall. Up obvious slab with corner crack.

P1: Slab crack to rib. Tree belay. 5.4 30m

P2: Up wall above passing bolts. Tree belay. 5.5 30m

P3: Up to ledge, head left. Gear belay. 5.4 40m

P4: Up broken face passing 2 bolts to ledge. Gear belay. 5.6 30m

P5: Up short wall to top. Tree belay. 5.3 15m

Descent: Hike up and scramble down left.



Head left to obvious slab.

Single rack to 2". One 60m rope. Helmets

Start up the right slabs. Found a ram skull sitting on the top of the last pitch.

P1: Up rib to ledge. Tree belay. 5.5 30m

P2: Up short wall/crack to ramp out right. Tree belay. 5.5 30m

P3: Up right past piton. Slab to funky steep wall. Tree belay. 5.5 30m

P4: Straight up rib, cracks and slab to top. 5.5 45m

Descent: Hike right and down. Spot the ram skull on the way.



Right side of crag. 

Gear to 3". One 60m rope. Helmets.

Start up the obvious groove beneath the crack. 

P1: Stem up groove to short "headwall." Jam a crack moving up and left to another 2" crack. Funky climbing on loose rock. Gain easier climbing up to main crack up high. Bolted belay. 5.8 40m

P2: Up the wicked crack. Stems and jams. Awkward and downsloping marble-like rock. Head for the splitter hand crack. Big undercling and crimps on the right wall help. Bolted belay. 5.9 30m

P3: Climb steep rock past bolt and up slab with bolt to fun crack. Tree belay. 5.5 25m

P4: Straight up. #3 behind flake, pull bulge and up easy but loose and dirty stone. About 15 metres between bad gear placements. Tree belay. 5.5R 45m

Descent: Hike up and down right.



Follow your nose to the zone beneath the obvious right-hand crack.

Gear to 3". One 60m rope. Helmets.

South-facing 150-metre-ish wall above Vermilion Lakes in the town of Banff. Scrappy lower pitches, good up high. Limestone and marble. Crazy no climbs had been done here. A low rock feature on Mount Norquay. The climbs are adventurous and run out. This is not a wall for newer climbers. The dirty stone isn't fully loose but there are sections of choss. Overall, the rock quality is amazing, full of features and holds, and the gear is solid. Bolts only where they're needed, maybe 15 fixed bolts/pitons in total on the wall. All routes FA'd in spring/summer 2022.
